page.title: 07RELIGION-GREAT DUNMOW
page.content: We visited St Mary's church which dates from the 13th century.Reverend Matthews helped us with our research, he told us that there nearly was a fire when candles in the church were left burning on the altar,one candle was faulty and snapped off as it burned,luckily it balanced on the candlestick.We saw an old beam which used to be 23 centimetres thick but it had been eaten away to 3 cms by the deathwatch beetle.There are 3 services each Sunday,the Sunday School meets at eleven o'clock every Sunday,some children from our school sing in the choir.A few boys go to bell ringing each Tuesday. There is a Catholic, Baptist and a United Reform church,a few children from our school are regular church goers.Most of these go to St.Mary's church.
